disease_recognition package

Submodules

disease_recognition.data module

disease_recognition.data.load_data(dataset: str) → str[source]

Load dataset from Kaggle Hub

Parameters:

dataset (str) – The Kaggle dataset identifier in the format “username/dataset-name”

Returns:

The local path where the dataset is downloaded

Return type:

str

Raises:

ValueError – If the dataset identifier is invalid or the download fails

Example

path = load_data(“username/dataset-name”)

disease_recognition.model module

disease_recognition.model.init_model(input_shape: tuple) → YOLO[source]

Initialize the YOLO model with the given input shape :param input_shape: The desired input shape for the model (height, width) :type input_shape: tuple

Returns:

The initialized YOLO model

Return type:

model (YOLO)

Raise:s:

ValueError: If the input_shape is not a tuple of two integers

Example

model = init_model((420, 420))

Note: YOLOv8 does not require explicit input shape setting during initialization.

disease_recognition.model.train_model(data: str, weights: YOLO = 'yolov8n.pt', device='cpu', epochs=100, batch=2, imgsz=420, patience=50) → tuple[YOLO, DataFrame][source]

Train the YOLO model with the given parameters :param data: Path to the dataset configuration file :type data: str :param weights: Pre-trained weights to start training from :type weights: YOLO :param device: Device to use for training (“cpu” or “cuda”) :type device: str :param epochs: Number of training epochs :type epochs: int :param batch: Batch size for training :type batch: int :param imgsz: Image size for training :type imgsz: int :param patience: Number of epochs with no improvement to stop training early :type patience: int

Returns:

The trained YOLO model results (pd.DataFrame): DataFrame containing training results and metrics

Return type:

model (YOLO)

Example

model, results = train_model(“data.yaml”, weights=”yolov8n.pt”, device=”cuda”, epochs=50, batch=16, imgsz=640, patience=10)

Note: Ensure that the dataset is properly formatted and the data.yaml file is correctly set up.

disease_recognition.model.val_model(data: str, weights, device='cpu', batch=12, imgsz=420) → YOLO[source]

Validate the YOLO model with the given parameters :param data: Path to the dataset configuration file :type data: str :param weights: Path to the trained model weights :type weights: str :param device: Device to use for validation (“cpu” or “cuda”) :type device: str :param batch: Batch size for validation :type batch: int :param imgsz: Image size for validation :type imgsz: int

Returns:

The validation results object containing metrics

Return type:

results (YOLO)

Example

results = val_model(“data.yaml”, “best.pt”, device=”cuda”, batch=16, imgsz=640)

Note: Ensure that the dataset is properly formatted and the data.yaml file is correctly set up.

disease_recognition.registry module

class disease_recognition.registry.YOLOModelWrapper[source]

Bases: PythonModel

Custom MLflow PyFunc model wrapper for YOLO

load_context(context)[source]

Load the YOLO model from the provided context

predict(context, model_input)[source]

Make predictions using the YOLO model

disease_recognition.registry.load_model(model_storage, filename, path, stage='Production', bucket_name=None, mlflow_tracking_uri=None, mlflow_model_name=None)[source]

Load a model from the specified model_storage :param model_storage: The storage option to load the model from (“local”, “gcs”, or “mlflow”) :type model_storage: str :param stage: The stage of the model to load from MLflow (“Staging” or “Production”). Default is “Production” :type stage: str, optional :param bucket_name: The GCS bucket name if model_storage is “gcs” :type bucket_name: str, optional :param filename: The filename of the model to load if model_storage is “local” or “gcs” :type filename: str, optional :param path: The local path to load the model from if model_storage is “local” :type path: str, optional :param mlflow_tracking_uri: The MLflow tracking URI if model_storage is “mlflow” :type mlflow_tracking_uri: str, optional :param mlflow_model_name: The registered model name in MLflow if model_storage is “mlflow” :type mlflow_model_name: str, optional

Returns:

The loaded YOLO model or MLflow pyfunc model

Return type:

model (YOLO or pyfunc)

Example

model = load_model(“local”, path=”./models”, filename=”my_model.pt”) model = load_model(“gcs”, bucket_name=”my_bucket”, filename=”my_model.pt”) model = load_model(“mlflow”, mlflow_tracking_uri=”http://localhost:5000”, mlflow_model_name=”my_mlflow_model”, stage=”Production”)

Note: Ensure that the model_storage is either “local”, “gcs”, or “mlflow”.

disease_recognition.registry.mlflow_run(func)[source]

Decorator to run a function within an MLflow run context :param func: The function to be executed within the MLflow run context :type func: function

Returns:

The wrapped function that runs within the MLflow context

Return type:

function

Example

@mlflow_run

disease_recognition.registry.robust_model_download(model_uri, path, filename, max_retries=3)[source]

Robustly download a model from MLflow with retry logic :param model_uri: The MLflow model URI to download :type model_uri: str :param path: The local path to save the downloaded model :type path: str :param filename: The filename to save the model as :type filename: str :param max_retries: Maximum number of retry attempts. Default is 3 :type max_retries: int, optional

Returns:

The loaded YOLO model or None if download failed

Return type:

model (YOLO or None)

Example

model = robust_model_download(“models:/my_mlflow_model/Production”, “./models”, “my_model.pt”)

disease_recognition.registry.save_model(model, model_storage, path, filename=None, bucket_name=None, mlflow_tracking_uri=None, mlflow_model_name=None)[source]

Save the trained model to the specified model_storage :param model: The trained YOLO model to be saved :type model: YOLO :param model_storage: The storage option to save the model (“local”, “gcs”, or “mlflow”) :type model_storage: str :param path: The local path to save the model if model_storage is “local” :type path: str :param filename: The filename to save the model as. If None, a timestamped filename will be generated :type filename: str, optional :param bucket_name: The GCS bucket name if model_storage is “gcs” :type bucket_name: str, optional :param mlflow_tracking_uri: The MLflow tracking URI if model_storage is “mlflow” :type mlflow_tracking_uri: str, optional :param mlflow_model_name: The registered model name in MLflow if model_storage is “mlflow” :type mlflow_model_name: str, optional

Returns:

None

Example

save_model(model, “local”, “./models”, “my_model.pt”) save_model(model, “gcs”, “./models”, bucket_name=”my_bucket”) save_model(model, “mlflow”, None, mlflow_model_name=”my_mlflow_model”)

Note: Ensure that the model_storage is either “local”, “gcs”, or “mlflow”.

disease_recognition.registry.save_results(model_storage, params=None, metrics=None, path=None, filename=None)[source]

Save training/validation results to a CSV file :param model_storage: The storage option to save results (“local” or “mlflow”) :type model_storage: str :param params: Dictionary of parameters used during training :type params: dict :param metrics: Dictionary of metrics obtained during training :type metrics: dict

Returns:

None

Example

save_results(“local”, {“epochs”: 100, “batch_size”: 16}, {“mAP”: 0.85, “loss”: 0.1})

Note: Ensure that the model_storage is either “local” or “mlflow”.
